content: ehuss pinged me just now about an inability to merge on the RFC repo. Looking into it it appears that the master branch has extra permissions where only anyone with "maintain" access is allowed to push (plus a required review). The rust-lang/libs github team is also allowed to push. I'm going to add rfc-pushers as a GitHub team allowed to push to the repo. Wanted to give a heads up in case this is unintended!
hm I think rfc-pushers is probably too broad but I'm not too worried, not like the repo is hooked up to any infra
@Alex Crichton I think the all team might be better
it's at least maintained by the team repo
adding the rust-lang/all team to push to the master branch of the rfcs repo?
I can add that if desired yeah
(instead of rfc-pushers which should probably be deleted, no idea what that corresponds to other than historical artifact)
hm the little dropdown box isn't letting me do that
ok I added all with write access (probably subscribed half the people woops)
and removed that rule, I don't think we need to restrict pushing

seems like rust-lang/all were automatically subscribed to the rfc repo..?
(got notification mail and too me a while to figure out what happened)
yes all has write access now and github auto subscribes, though it really shouldn't
I think you can individually turn it off
